alert.note: Alert for Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southwest Big Horn Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 6:39PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Hot Springs County through 700 PM MDT... At 636 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms near Hamilton Dome, which is also 22 miles west of Thermopolis. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Very heavy rain and pea sized hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Washes and ditches are likely to fill with water. This storm will remain over the Owl Creek and Cottonwood Creek drainages west of Wyoming Highway 120. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Very heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southwest Big Horn Basin
